org.alljoyn.bus

Class BusAttachment

  • Object
    • BusAttachment

  • public class BusAttachment
extends Object
    A connection to a message bus. Using BusAttachment, an application may register objects on the bus for other bus connections to access. BusAttachment is also used to access remote objects that have been registered by other processes and/or remote devices.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  BusAttachment.RemoteMessage
      Policy for handling messages received from remote devices.

        public static final int ALLJOYN_MAX_PACKET_LEN
        The maximum length of an AllJoyn packet. AllJoyn limits the total size of a packetized Message to 2^17 bytes.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ALLJOYN_MAX_ARRAY_LEN

        public static final int ALLJOYN_MAX_ARRAY_LEN
        The maximum length of an array sent in an AllJoyn Message. AllJoyn limits arrays to a maximum sze of 2^16
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

                     Object val,

        Emit PropertiesChanged to signal the bus that this property has been updated
        Parameters:
        busObject - The BusObject that is the source of this signal
        ifcName - The name of the interface
        propName - The name of the property being changed
        val - The new value of the property

      • requestName

        public Status requestName(String name,
                 int flags)
        Request a well-known name. This method is a shortcut/helper that issues an org.freedesktop.DBus.RequestName method call to the local router and interprets the response.
        Parameters:
        name - Well-known name being requested.
        flags - Bitmask name flag (see DBusStd.h)
        • ALLJOYN_NAME_FLAG_ALLOW_REPLACEMENT
        • ALLJOYN_REQUESTNAME_FLAG_REPLACE_EXISTING
        • ALLJOYN_REQUESTNAME_FLAG_DO_NOT_QUEUE
        Returns:
        • OK if request completed successfully and primary ownership was granted.
        • BUS_NOT_CONNECTED if a connection has not been made with a local bus
        • other error status codes indicating a failure.

      • releaseName

        Release a previously requeted well-known name. This method is a shortcut/helper that issues an org.freedesktop.DBus.ReleaseName method call to the local router and interprets the response.
        Parameters:
        name - Well-known name being released.
        Returns:
        • OK if the name was released.
        • BUS_NOT_CONNECTED if a connection has not been made with a local bus
        • other error status codes indicating a failure.

      • advertiseName

        public Status advertiseName(String name,
                   short transports)
        Advertise the existence of a well-known name to other (possibly disconnected) AllJoyn routers. This method is a shortcut/helper that issues an org.allJoyn.Bus.AdvertisedName method call to the local router and interprets the response.
        Parameters:
        name - The well-known name to advertise. (Must be owned by the caller via RequestName).
        transports - Set of transports to use for sending advertisment.
        Returns:
        • OK if the name was advertised.
        • BUS_NOT_CONNECTED if a connection has not been made with a local bus
        • other error status codes indicating a failure

        public Status cancelAdvertiseName(String name,
                         short transports)
        Stop advertising the existence of a well-known name to other AllJoyn routers. This method is a shortcut/helper that issues an org.allJoyn.Bus.CancelAdvertiseName method call to the local router and interprets the response.
        Parameters:
        name - A well-known name that was previously advertised via AdvertiseName.
        transports - Set of transports whose name advertisment will be cancelled.
        Returns:
        • OK if the name advertisements were stopped.
        • BUS_NOT_CONNECTED if a connection has not been made with a local bus
        • other error status codes indicating a failure.

        • BUS_NOT_CONNECTED if a connection has not been made with a local bus
        • other error status codes indicating a failure.

This method is a shortcut/helper that issues an org.allJoyn.Bus.CancelFindAdvertisedName method call to the local router and interprets the response.
        Parameters:
        namePrefix - Well-known name prefix that application is no longer interested in receiving BusListener::FoundAdvertisedName notifications about.
        Returns:
        • OK if discovery was cancelled.
        • BUS_NOT_CONNECTED if a connection has not been made with a local bus
        • other error status codes indicating a general failure condition.

      • bindSessionPort

        public Status bindSessionPort(Mutable.ShortValue sessionPort,
                     SessionOpts opts,
                     SessionPortListener listener)
        Make a SessionPort available for external BusAttachments to join. Each BusAttachment binds its own set of SessionPorts. Session joiners use the bound session port along with the name of the attachement to create a persistent logical connection (called a Session) with the original BusAttachment. A SessionPort and bus name form a unique identifier that BusAttachments use when joining a session. SessionPort values can be pre-arranged between AllJoyn services and their clients (well-known SessionPorts). Once a session is joined using one of the service's well-known SessionPorts, the service may bind additional SessionPorts (dyanamically) and share these SessionPorts with the joiner over the original session. The joiner can then create additional sessions with the service by calling JoinSession with these dynamic SessionPort ids.
        Parameters:
        sessionPort - SessionPort value to bind or SESSION_PORT_ANY to allow this method to choose an available port. On successful return, this value contains the chosen SessionPort.
        opts - Session options that joiners must agree to in order to successfully join the session.
        listener - SessionPortListener that will be notified via callback when a join attempt is made on the bound session port.
        Returns:
        • OK if the new session port was bound.
        • BUS_NOT_CONNECTED if a connection has not been made with a local bus
        • other error status codes indicating a failure.

      • setDescriptionTranslator

        public void setDescriptionTranslator(Translator translator)
        Set a Translator for all BusObjects and InterfaceDescriptions. This Translator is used for descriptions appearing in introspection. Note that any Translators set on a specific InterfaceDescription or BusObject will be used for those specific elements - this Translator is used only for BusObjects and InterfaceDescriptions that do not have Translators set for them.
        Parameters:
        translator - The Translator instance

      • unbindSessionPort

        public Status unbindSessionPort(short sessionPort)
        Cancel an existing port binding.
        Parameters:
        sessionPort - Existing session port to be un-bound.
        Returns:
        • OK if the session port was unbound.
        • BUS_NOT_CONNECTED if connection has not been made with the local router.
        • other error status codes indicating a failure

      • joinSession

        public Status joinSession(String sessionHost,
                 short sessionPort,
                 Mutable.IntegerValue sessionId,
                 SessionOpts opts,
                 SessionListener listener)
        Join a session. This method is a shortcut/helper that issues an org.allJoyn.Bus.JoinSession method call to the local router and interprets the response.
        Parameters:
        sessionHost - Bus name of attachment that is hosting the session to be joined.
        sessionPort - SessionPort of sessionHost to be joined.
        sessionId - Set to the unique identifier for session.
        opts - Set to the actual session options of the joined session.
        listener - Listener to be called when session related asynchronous events occur.
        Returns:
        • OK if the session was joined.
        • BUS_NOT_CONNECTED if a connection has not been made with a local bus
        • other error status codes indicating a failure.

      • joinSession

        public Status joinSession(String sessionHost,
                 short sessionPort,
                 SessionOpts opts,
                 SessionListener listener,
                 OnJoinSessionListener onJoinSession,
                 Object context)
        Asynchronous version of joinSession(String, short, Mutable.IntegerValue, SessionOpts, SessionListener).
        Parameters:
        sessionHost - Bus name of attachment that is hosting the session to be joined.
        sessionPort - SessionPort of sessionHost to be joined.
        opts - The requested session options of the session to be joined.
        listener - Listener to be called when session related asynchronous events occur.
        onJoinSession - Listener to be called when joinSession completes.
        context - User-defined context object. Passed through to OnJoinSessionListener.onJoinSession(Status, int, SessionOpts, Object).
        Returns:
        • OK iff method call to local router response was was successful.
        • BUS_NOT_CONNECTED if a connection has not been made with a local bus.
        • Other error status codes indicating a failure.

        Returns:

        • BUS_NOT_CONNECTED if a connection has not been made with a local bus

        public Status removeSessionMember(int sessionId,

        Parameters:
        sessionId - Session id.
        sessionMemberName - Name of member to remove from session.
        Returns:
        • OK if router response was left.
        • BUS_NOT_CONNECTED if a connection has not been made with a local bus
        • other error status codes indicating failures.

      • setSessionListener

        public Status setSessionListener(int sessionId,
                        SessionListener listener)
        Set the SessionListener for an existing session. Calling this method will override (replace) the listener set by a previoius call to setSessionListener or a listener specified in joinSession.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The session id of an existing session.
        listener - The SessionListener to associate with the session. May be null to clear previous listener.
        Returns:
        ER_OK if successful.

      • getSessionFd

        public Status getSessionFd(int sessionId,
                  Mutable.IntegerValue sockFd)
        Get the file descriptor for a raw (non-message based) session.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - Id of an existing streamming session.
        sockFd - Socket file descriptor for session.
        Returns:
        • Status.OK if the socket FD was returned.
        • ER_BUS_NOT_CONNECTED if a connection has not been made with a local bus
        • other error status codes indicating a failure.

      • setLinkTimeout

        public Status setLinkTimeout(int sessionId,
                    Mutable.IntegerValue linkTimeout)
        Set the link timeout for a session. Link timeout is the maximum number of seconds that an unresponsive router-to-router connection will be monitored before delcaring the session lost (via SessionLost callback). Link timeout defaults to 0 which indicates that AllJoyn link monitoring is disabled. Each transport type defines a lower bound on link timeout to avoid defeating transport specific power management algorithms.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - Id of session whose link timeout will be modified.
        linkTimeout - [IN/OUT] Max number of seconds that a link can be unresponsive before being delcared lost. 0 indicates that AllJoyn link monitoring will be disabled. On return, this value will be the resulting (possibly upward) adjusted linkTimeout value that acceptible to the underlying transport.
        Returns:
        • Status.OK if the linkTimeout was successfully modified
        • ER_BUS_NOT_CONNECTED if a connection has not been made with a local bus

      • getPeerGUID

        public Status getPeerGUID(String name,
                 Mutable.StringValue guid)
        Get the peer GUID for this peer or an authenticated remote peer. Peer GUIDs are used by the authentication mechanisms to uniquely and identify a remote application instance. The peer GUID for a remote peer is only available if the remote peer has been authenticated.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of a remote peer or NULL to get the local (our) peer GUID.
        guid - Mutable value that contains a reference to the returned GUID string (think C++ [out] parameter.
        Returns:
        • OK if the requested GUID was obtained
        • other error status codes indicating a failure

      • ping

        public Status ping(String name,
          int timeout)
        Determine if a name is present and responding by pinging it. The name can be the unique or well-known name.
        Parameters:
        name - The unique or well-known name to ping
        timeout - Timeout specified in milliseconds to wait for reply
        Returns:
        • OK the name is present and responding
        • ALLJOYN_PING_REPLY_UNREACHABLE the name is no longer present
        The following return values indicate that the router cannot determine if the remote name is present and responding:
        • ALLJOYN_PING_REPLY_TIMEOUT Ping call timed out
        • ALLJOYN_PING_REPLY_UNKNOWN_NAME name not found currently or not part of any known session
        • ALLJOYN_PING_REPLY_INCOMPATIBLE_REMOTE_ROUTING_NODE the remote routing node does not implement Ping
        The following return values indicate an error with the ping call itself:
        • ALLJOYN_PING_FAILED Ping failed
        • BUS_UNEXPECTED_DISPOSITION An unexpected disposition was returned and has been treated as an error
        • BUS_NOT_CONNECTED the BusAttachment is not connected to the bus
        • BUS_BAD_BUS_NAME the name parameter is not a valid bus name
        • An error status otherwise

      • ping

        public Status ping(String name,
          int timeout,
          OnPingListener onPing,
          Object context)
        Asynchronous version of ping(String, int).
        Parameters:
        name - The unique or well-known name to ping
        timeout - Timeout specified in milliseconds to wait for reply
        onPing - Listener to be called when ping completes.
        context - User-defined context object. Passed through to OnPingListener.onPing(Status, Object).
        Returns:
        • OK iff method call to local router response was was successful.
        • BUS_NOT_CONNECTED if a connection has not been made with a local bus.
        • BUS_BAD_BUS_NAME if the name passed in is an invalid bus name.
        • Other error status codes indicating a failure.

      • setDaemonDebug

        public Status setDaemonDebug(String module,
                    int level)
        This sets the debug level of the local AllJoyn router if that router was built in debug mode. The debug level can be set for individual subsystems or for "ALL" subsystems. Common subsystems are "ALLJOYN" for core AllJoyn code, "ALLJOYN_OBJ" for the sessions management code, "ALLJOYN_BT" for the Bluetooth subsystem, "ALLJOYN_BTC" for the Bluetooth topology manager, and "ALLJOYN_NS" for the TCP name services. Debug levels for specific subsystems override the setting for "ALL" subsystems. For example if "ALL" is set to 7, but "ALLJOYN_OBJ" is set to 1, then detailed debug output will be generated for all subsystems expcept for "ALLJOYN_OBJ" which will only generate high level debug output. "ALL" defaults to 0 which is off, or no debug output. The debug output levels are actually a bit field that controls what output is generated. Those bit fields are described below:
        • 0x1: High level debug prints (these debug prints are not common)
        • 0x2: Normal debug prints (these debug prints are common)
        • 0x4: Function call tracing (these debug prints are used sporadically)
        • 0x8: Data dump (really only used in the "SOCKET" module - can generate a lot of output)
        Typically, when enabling debug for a subsystem, the level would be set to 7 which enables High level debug, normal debug, and function call tracing. Setting the level 0, forces debug output to be off for the specified subsystem.
        Parameters:
        module - the name of the module to generate debug output from.
        level - the debug level to set for the module.
        Returns:
        • OK if debug request was successfully sent to the AllJoyn router
        • BUS_NO_SUCH_OBJECT if router was not built in debug mode.

      • setLogLevels

        public void setLogLevels(String logEnv)
        Set AllJoyn logging levels.
        Parameters:
        logEnv - A semicolon separated list of KEY=VALUE entries used to set the log levels for internal AllJoyn modules. (i.e. ALLJOYN=7;ALL=1)

      • setDebugLevel

        public void setDebugLevel(String module,
                 int level)
        Set AllJoyn debug levels.
        Parameters:
        module - name of the module to generate debug output
        level - debug level to set for the module

      • useOSLogging

        public void useOSLogging(boolean useOSLog)
        Indicate whether AllJoyn logging goes to OS logger or stdout
        Parameters:
        useOSLog - true iff OS specific logging should be used rather than print for AllJoyn debug messages.

      • registerBusListener

        public void registerBusListener(BusListener listener)
        Register an object that will receive bus event notifications.
        Parameters:
        listener - Object instance that will receive bus event notifications.

      • unregisterBusListener

        public void unregisterBusListener(BusListener listener)
        unregister an object that was previously registered with RegisterBusListener.
        Parameters:
        listener - Object instance to un-register as a listener.

      • release

        public void release()
        Release resources immediately. Normally, when all references are removed to a given object, the Java garbage collector notices the fact that the object is no longer required and will destroy it. This can happen at the garbage collector's leisure an so any resources held by the object will not be released until "some time later" after the object is no longer needed. Often, in test programs, we cycle through many BusAttachments in a very short time, and if we rely on the garbage collector to clean up, we can fairly quickly run out of scarce underlying resources -- especially file descriptors. We provide an explicity release() method to allow test programs to release the underlying resources immediately. The garbage collector will still call finalize, but the resources held by the underlying C++ objects will go away immediately. It is a programming error to call another method on the BusAttachment after the release() method has been called.

      • connect

        public Status connect()
        Starts the message bus and connects to the local router. This method blocks until the connection attempt succeeds or fails.

        BusObjectListener.registered() is called by the bus when the bus is connected.

        Returns:
        OK if successful

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Indicate whether bus is currently connected.
        Returns:
        true if the bus is connected

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnects from the local router and stops the message bus.

      • registerBusObject

        public Status registerBusObject(BusObject busObj,
                       String objPath)
        Registers a bus object. Once registered, the bus object may communicate to and from other objects via its implemented bus interfaces.

        The same object may not be registered on multiple bus connections.

        Parameters:
        busObj - the BusObject to register
        objPath - the object path of the BusObject
        Returns:
        OK if successful
        See Also:
        BusInterface

      • registerBusObject

        public Status registerBusObject(BusObject busObj,
                       String objPath,
                       boolean secure)
        Registers a bus object. Once registered, the bus object may communicate to and from other objects via its implemented bus interfaces.

        The same object may not be registered on multiple bus connections.

        Parameters:
        busObj - the BusObject to register
        objPath - the object path of the BusObject
        secure - true if authentication is required to access this object
        Returns:
        OK if successful
        See Also:
        BusInterface

      • registerBusObject

        public Status registerBusObject(BusObject busObj,
                       String objPath,
                       boolean secure,
                       String languageTag,
                       String description)
        Registers a bus object. Once registered, the bus object may communicate to and from other objects via its implemented bus interfaces.

        The same object may not be registered on multiple bus connections.

        Parameters:

        objPath - the object path of the BusObject

        languageTag - a language tag describing the language of the description of this BusObject
        description - a textual description of this BusObject
        Returns:
        OK if successful
        See Also:

      • registerBusObject

        public Status registerBusObject(BusObject busObj,
                       String objPath,
                       boolean secure,
                       String languageTag,
                       String description,
                       Translator dt)
        Registers a bus object. Once registered, the bus object may communicate to and from other objects via its implemented bus interfaces.

        The same object may not be registered on multiple bus connections.

        Parameters:
        busObj - the BusObject to register
        objPath - the object path of the BusObject
        secure - true if authentication is required to access this object
        languageTag - a language tag describing the language of the description of this BusObject

        dt - a Translator instance to translate descriptions of this object

        See Also:

      • isBusObjectSecure

        public boolean isBusObjectSecure(BusObject busObj)
        Indicates if the BusObject is secure.
        Returns:
        Return true if authentication is required to emit signals or call methods on this object.

      • unregisterBusObject

        public void unregisterBusObject(BusObject obj)
        Unregisters a bus object.
        Parameters:
        obj - the BusObject to unregister

      • getProxyBusObject

        public ProxyBusObject getProxyBusObject(String busName,
                               String objPath,
                               int sessionId,
                               Class[] busInterfaces)
        Creates a proxy bus object for a remote bus object. Methods on the remote object can be invoked through the proxy object.

        There is no guarantee that the remote object referred to by the proxy acutally exists. If the remote object does not exist, proxy method calls will fail.

        Java proxy classes do not allow methods from two different interfaces to have the same name and calling parameters. If two AllJoyn methods from two different interfaces are implemented by the same remote object, one (or both) of the method names must be modified. You may then use an annotation for the renamed method to cause AllJoyn to use the originally expected method name in any "wire" operations.

        Parameters:
        busName - the remote endpoint name (well-known or unique)
        objPath - the absolute (non-relative) object path for the object
        sessionId - the session corresponding to the connection to the the object
        busInterfaces - an array of BusInterfaces that this proxy should respond to
        Returns:
        a ProxyBusObject for an object that implements all interfaces listed in busInterfaces
        See Also:
        BusMethod

      • getProxyBusObject

        public ProxyBusObject getProxyBusObject(String busName,
                               String objPath,
                               int sessionId,
                               Class[] busInterfaces,
                               boolean secure)
        Creates a proxy bus object for a remote bus object. Methods on the remote object can be invoked through the proxy object.

        There is no guarantee that the remote object referred to by the proxy acutally exists. If the remote object does not exist, proxy method calls will fail.

        Java proxy classes do not allow methods from two different interfaces to have the same name and calling parameters. If two AllJoyn methods from two different interfaces are implemented by the same remote object, one (or both) of the method names must be modified. You may then use an annotation for the renamed method to cause AllJoyn to use the originally expected method name in any "wire" operations.

        Parameters:
        busName - the remote endpoint name (well-known or unique)
        objPath - the absolute (non-relative) object path for the object
        sessionId - the session corresponding to the connection to the the object
        busInterfaces - an array of BusInterfaces that this proxy should respond to
        secure - the security mode for the remote object
        Returns:
        a ProxyBusObject for an object that implements all interfaces listed in busInterfaces
        See Also:
        BusMethod

      • getDBusProxyObj

        public DBusProxyObj getDBusProxyObj()
        Gets the DBusProxyObj interface of the org.freedesktop.DBus proxy object. The DBusProxyObj interface is provided for backwards compatibility with the DBus protocol.
        Returns:
        the DBusProxyObj interface

      • getUniqueName

        public String getUniqueName()
        Get the unique name of this BusAttachment.
        Returns:
        the unique name of this BusAttachment

      • getGlobalGUIDString

        public String getGlobalGUIDString()
        Get the GUID of this BusAttachment. The returned value may be appended to an advertised well-known name in order to guarantee that the resulting name is globally unique.
        Returns:
        GUID of this BusAttachment as a string.

      • registerSignalHandler

        public Status registerSignalHandler(String ifaceName,
                           String signalName,
                           Object obj,
                           Method handlerMethod)
        Registers a public method to receive a signal from all objects emitting it. Once registered, the method of the object will receive the signal specified from all objects implementing the interface.
        Parameters:
        ifaceName - the interface name of the signal
        signalName - the member name of the signal
        obj - the object receiving the signal
        handlerMethod - the signal handler method
        Returns:
        OK if the register is succesful

      • registerSignalHandler

        public Status registerSignalHandler(String ifaceName,
                           String signalName,
                           Object obj,
                           Method handlerMethod,
                           String source)
        Registers a public method to receive a signal from specific objects emitting it. Once registered, the method of the object will receive the signal specified from objects implementing the interface.
        Parameters:
        ifaceName - the interface name of the signal
        signalName - the member name of the signal
        obj - the object receiving the signal
        handlerMethod - the signal handler method
        source - the object path of the emitter of the signal
        Returns:
        OK if the register is succesful

      • registerSignalHandlers

        public Status registerSignalHandlers(Object obj)
        Registers all public methods that are annotated as signal handlers.
        Parameters:
        obj - object with methods annotated with as signal handlers
        Returns:
        • OK if the register is succesful
        • BUS_NO_SUCH_INTERFACE if the interface and signal specified in any @BusSignalHandler annotations of obj are unknown to this BusAttachment. See BusSignalHandler for a discussion of how to annotate signal handlers.

      • unregisterSignalHandler

        public void unregisterSignalHandler(Object obj,
                           Method handlerMethod)
        Unregisters a signal handler.
        Parameters:
        obj - the object receiving the signal
        handlerMethod - the signal handler method

      • unregisterSignalHandlers

        public void unregisterSignalHandlers(Object obj)

        Parameters:
        obj - object with previously annotated signal handlers that have been registered
        See Also:
        BusSignalHandler

      • registerKeyStoreListener

        public void registerKeyStoreListener(KeyStoreListener listener)
        Registers a user-defined key store listener to override the default key store. This must be called prior to connect().
        Parameters:
        listener - the key store listener

      • clearKeyStore

        public void clearKeyStore()
        Clears all stored keys from the key store. All store keys and authentication information is deleted and cannot be recovered. Any passwords or other credentials will need to be reentered when establishing secure peer connections.

      • clearKeys

        public Status clearKeys(String guid)
        Clear the keys associated with a specific peer identified by its GUID.
        Parameters:
        guid - The guid of a remote authenticated peer.
        Returns:
        • OK if the key was cleared
        • UNKNOWN GUID if theere is no peer with the specified GUID
        • other error status codes indicating a failure

      • setKeyExpiration

        public Status setKeyExpiration(String guid,
                      int timeout)
        Sets the expiration time on keys associated with a specific remote peer as identified by its peer GUID. The peer GUID associated with a bus name can be obtained by calling getPeerGUID(String, Mutable.StringValue). If the timeout is 0 this is equivalent to calling clearKeys(String).
        Parameters:
        guid - the GUID of a remote authenticated peer
        timeout - the time in seconds relative to the current time to expire the keys
        Returns:
        • OK if the expiration time was succesfully set
        • UNKNOWN_GUID if there is no authenticated peer with the specified GUID

      • getKeyExpiration

        public Status getKeyExpiration(String guid,
                      Mutable.IntegerValue timeout)
        Gets the expiration time on keys associated with a specific authenticated remote peer as identified by its peer GUID. The peer GUID associated with a bus name can be obtained by calling getPeerGUID(String, Mutable.StringValue).
        Parameters:
        guid - the GUID of a remote authenticated peer
        timeout - the time in seconds relative to the current time when the keys will expire
        Returns:
        • OK if the expiration time was succesfully set
        • UNKNOWN_GUID if there is no authenticated peer with the specified GUID

      • reloadKeyStore

        public Status reloadKeyStore()
        Reloads the key store for this bus attachment. This function would normally only be called in the case where a single key store is shared between multiple bus attachments, possibly by different applications. It is up to the applications to coordinate how and when the shared key store is modified.
        Returns:
        • OK if the key store was succesfully reloaded
        • An error status indicating that the key store reload failed

      • registerAuthListener

        public Status registerAuthListener(String authMechanisms,
                          AuthListener listener,
                          String keyStoreFileName,
                          boolean isShared)
        Registers a user-defined authentication listener class with a specific default key store.
        Parameters:
        authMechanisms - the authentication mechanism(s) to use for peer-to-peer authentication. This is a space separated list of any of the following values: ALLJOYN_PIN_KEYX, ALLJOYN_SRP_LOGON, ALLJOYN_RSA_KEYX, ALLJOYN_SRP_KEYX, ALLJOYN_ECDHE_NULL, ALLJOYN_ECDHE_PSK, ALLJOYN_ECDHE_ECDSA.
        listener - the authentication listener
        keyStoreFileName - the name of the default key store. Under Android, the recommended value of this parameter is Context.getFileStreamPath("alljoyn_keystore").getAbsolutePath(). Note that the default key store implementation may be overrided with registerKeyStoreListener(KeyStoreListener).
        isShared - Set to true if the default keystore will be shared between multiple programs. all programs must have read/write permissions to the keyStoreFileName file.
        Returns:
        OK if successful

      • registerAuthListener

        public Status registerAuthListener(String authMechanisms,
                          AuthListener listener,
                          String keyStoreFileName)
        Registers a user-defined authentication listener class with a specific default key store.
        Parameters:
        authMechanisms - the authentication mechanism(s) to use for peer-to-peer authentication. This is a space separated list of any of the following values: ALLJOYN_PIN_KEYX, ALLJOYN_SRP_LOGON, ALLJOYN_RSA_KEYX, ALLJOYN_SRP_KEYX, ALLJOYN_ECDHE_NULL, ALLJOYN_ECDHE_PSK, ALLJOYN_ECDHE_ECDSA.
        listener - the authentication listener
        keyStoreFileName - the name of the default key store. Under Android, the recommended value of this parameter is Context.getFileStreamPath("alljoyn_keystore").getAbsolutePath(). Note that the default key store implementation may be overrided with registerKeyStoreListener(KeyStoreListener).
        Returns:
        OK if successful

      • registerAuthListener

        public Status registerAuthListener(String authMechanisms,
                          AuthListener listener)
        Registers a user-defined authentication listener class. Under Android, it is recommended to use registerAuthListener(String, AuthListener, String) instead to specify the path of the default key store.
        Parameters:
        authMechanisms - the authentication mechanism(s) to use for peer-to-peer authentication. This is a space separated list of any of the following values: ALLJOYN_PIN_KEYX, ALLJOYN_SRP_LOGON, ALLJOYN_RSA_KEYX, ALLJOYN_SRP_KEYX, ALLJOYN_ECDHE_NULL, ALLJOYN_ECDHE_PSK, ALLJOYN_ECDHE_ECDSA.
        listener - the authentication listener
        Returns:
        OK if successful

      • registerSecurityViolationListener

        public void registerSecurityViolationListener(SecurityViolationListener listener)
        Registers a user-defined security violation listener class.
        Parameters:
        listener - the security violation listener

      • getMessageContext

        public MessageContext getMessageContext()
        Gets the message context of the currently executing method, signal handler, or security violation. The context contains information about the method invoker or signal sender including any authentication that exists with this remote entity.

        This method can only be called from within the method, signal, or security violation handler itself since the caller's thread information is used to find the appropriate context.

        Returns:
        message context for the currently executing method, signal handler, security violation, or null if no message can be found for the calling thread

      • enableConcurrentCallbacks

        public void enableConcurrentCallbacks()
        Enable callbacks within the context of the currently executing method handler, signal handler or other AllJoyn callback.

        This method can ONLY be called from within the body of a signal handler, method handler or other AllJoyn callback. It allows AllJoyn to dispatch a single (additional) callback while the current one is still executing. This method is typically used when a method, signal handler or other AllJoyn callback needs to execute for a long period of time or when the callback needs to make any kind of blocking call.

        This method MUST be called prior to making any non-asynchronous AllJoyn remote procedure calls from within an AllJoyn callback. This includes calls such as joinSession(), advertiseName(), cancelAdvertisedName(), findAdvertisedName(), cancelFindAdvertisedName(), setLinkTimeout(), etc.
